title: Job: Miserable Comforters Are You All
summary: Job lashes out at his friends for their lack of comfort. He feels attacked by both men and God and describes his suffering in vivid terms. Still, he expresses a longing for a heavenly witness who will plead for him.

faq.question: How does Job describe his friends?
faq.answer: As 'miserable comforters' who only add to his pain.

faq.question: What hope does Job express?
faq.answer: That there is a heavenly advocate who will speak on his behalf.
